lg.l: The end is beginning, ‘tis ruin at last!

In the teeth of the drought Drought. The Federation Drought, which commenced in 1895 and peaked in 1901-2, affected most of eastern Australia and is regarded as one of the continent’s worst droughts. comes the tongue of the blast!
The stress of the hailstorm were better than this,
The wash of the flood-waters a vision of bliss.
The wind that is born in the plains of the west
Is never a friend, but too often a guest;
‘Twas the kiss of an iceberg when winter was here,
‘Tis a taste of Gehenna Gehenna. Hell, or the place of future torment. when summer is near.
It howls o’er the valleys, this agent accurst,
The sport of an awful, unquenchable thirst;
It shaketh its mane, and the eucalyptus Eucalyptus. Eucalyptus, or the gum tree, is a common forest tree throughout Australia. moan,
It gathers its strength, and the deep gullies groan.
It breathes on the plant with its feverish breath,
And its tendrals [sic] relax in the tortures of death;
It bleaches the pastures, and blackens the grain,
And labour is foolish, and industry vain.
‘Tis the blast of misfortune, the blight of despair,
The hot breath of anguish, the cold thrill of care;
It withers the heart, as it whitens the land,
And nothing in nature its thirst can withstand.
